reviews.review_msg: Amazing prof. I had never met anyone at the SFU Department of Mathematics so willing to give extra time to answer questions. His lectures are clear and often really interesting. He understands the groups necessities and adjusts the course's pace to improve the learning experience. Highly recommended.

One of da worst profs!! can't believe he's still using da chalkboard! he wasted most of the class time erasing da board!! and he likes to talk w/ his back facing u! his notes r vy vy messy & he luvs mumbling! he knows da stuff but can't teach!dont take this course w/ him! he'll screw u over!!
This class is very hard but mr. Chen is a good teacher.
Excellent teacher.  Midterm was a bit too easy compared to homework.  More willing than any prof I've seen to respond to questions 'above' subject material.

You need to continuously review the textbook to understand the topics, as lectures can be quite confusing (the textbook itself was quite confusing too).  Exams only tested the easier aspects of the course, so they were pretty straightforward.  Overall a pretty decent prof

Good prof. Gives interesting, clear, well-organized lectures and spices them up with sardonic sense of humour. Assignments are a lot of work. Weekly quizzes are tricky, but exams are fair. If you love math, you'll enjoy this class and this prof.
Very unorganized, very easy problems in lecture but very difficult exams.

He's an example of what a truly caring person is. You can also see his strong appreciation for math in his lectures - he's concerned with using his knowledge in meaningful ways. He teaches other classes and manages workshops by himself, so something might get lost in his big inbox. Work with him and he'll work with you; one of the best profs here!

He is one of my favourite profs at SFU. And the most organized prof I have ever had. His lecture is like doing a complicated puzzle with him, it is very satisfying, but you would get lost if you are not paying attention for even a second. For this reason, 242 is the only math class I never get sleepy lol. 242 is the most challenging course in LD.
This course is hard in general. All proofs and memorizing theorems. Got all 0 on the proofs questions. Didnt know what did I learn thought out the semester.
This course is all proofs. Do not try to take it as an elective. His notes was not clear. Tough grader on the test. Kinda boring in class. Midterm average barely pass. Expect half class fail.

Good professor but insanely hard course made even harder from harsh marking on exams. If you miss one thing in a proof he will take off tons of marks. Lectures are good and he seems like a cool guy. Assignments are very hard but tutorials help and hw is marked by TA. Don't take 242 if you don't love math, but if you have to take it, take w/ Nathan.
His assignments drive me crazy. The workload was tons. Assignment are super hard. Tests are hard. The course is hard. Just got no nice things to say about him.

This course is crazy. Midterm average was 52%. He said he would curve, but more than 20 people out of 79 people are getting lower than 30%, not sure if he would fail those 20 people or what. I would say he's a tough grader, no idea what is his standard to grade the prove. If there's other section,I wouldn't choose him.

Nathan is my favorite professor at SFU. He knows exactly what he's talking about and now's how to convey it. He's the most spread out math professor I've ever seen. His interests very and he knows so much. Would recommend going to office hours. Exam questions are like the ones from review class so go and listen and you'll do well. Enjoyable class

It's a hard class. Anyone saying otherwise would be lying. But Dr. Illten gave everyone the easiest path to a respectable grade with participation marks and very easy assessments. The homeworks are mind boggling hard but that's analysis for you.

He is a great teacher, if you expect to pass a class without attending or studying, why are you in the school? Midterms are a joke compared to the assignments, think logically and do not panic and it all sorts itself out. Don't study don't pass, grow up

Nathan can be really intimidating at first, and he has some questionable policies, but he really grew on me over the semester. His assignments were really over the top difficult, but his tests were fair.
Fantastic lecturer. Truly an expert

this is a review for math 320. dr sun is great. shes extremely helpful in office hours, so i highly encourage you to go. she doesn't post notes. shes always willing to stop and take the time to iron out confusion in lectures. exams are heavily based on homework/tutorial questions. lectures can sometimes be hard to follow for harder topics.

Professor Sun is easily the worst professor I have ever had in my entire SFU career. She gives insanely hard exams and has a very firm and cold demeanour. Makes course content harder than it has to be and purposely tries to confuse the learner. I am writing this inform you to drop the course you have with her for your own well being.

She is very helpful, gives you very clear answer to your questions. But make sure you read the textbook, because analytics is not an easy thing to learn AT ALL! You'd better roughly review the sections that she's about to teach, and carefully read textbooks after class (I think it's true for most MATH courses, many reviews didn't realize it)

Weiran is a good prof and a nice person. She listens to students' suggestions and very helpful during office hours. However, she is extremely tough marker. Generally, if you want a prof who is good at explaining concepts and has a talent for teaching then she is a solid choice. If you are all about getting an A, then it might be a problem.

Only a few weeks into the semester, but I already love Weiran. She's not easy (this is a good thing), but she is extremely organized. This is all that is needed from a professor for the student to succeed. I hope I can take more courses with this professor.

Honestly, Weiran Sun is the best mathematics professor I have had at SFU. She displays her concepts clearly and is very mathematically sound. She is an inspiration to me. She knows her material inside out and is always willing to help you understand the material

The lectures weren't helpful since he mostly read off the textbook, but the exams were fair though the final was a bit harder. He was reasonable with deadlines and scaled final grades by about 5%, which helped. Overall, he was average, but the course is tough and time-consuming, so expect to put in extra effort than your usual 3 credit math course.

Good professor who knows his stuff. Lectures go too fast, but that's a fault of the material. 242 has a reputation for being one of the most difficult math courses at SFU, and it's well-deserved. Be prepared to spend way more hours than you think on homework and studying. Overall a fair prof, but the final was tricky. He did scale us up though.
He read off the textbook word for word, lectures were of no use. This class tanked my GPA.

Avoid if possible. I had no choice since the course is offered only once a year, but it ruined my GPA. Lectures are just the prof writing notes like it's an English essay — no real explanation of concepts. Doesn't feel like a math class. No helpful online resources either. Not recommended for a proof-based course.

If you see him teaching Analysis MATH 242 dont take him cuz he will be reading off the textbook anyway (Word by Word). You can learn it faster if you just read the book 

I wouldn't recommend him

I did well in this class but more so out of my love for deeply understanding math and self-cleaning skills NOT the professor. This professor assaults the mental health and confidence of perfectly good and very intelligent students. It is unnecessary and she plays cruel psychological games with students. It is shameful.

Worst teacher ! Midterm is only fousing in the concepts, not application. Many homework and midterm is never based on it . Worst ever! Its no teach students figure out questions. She wants everyone to fail this course. Worst ever
Not very helpful. Steer clear if possible.

Worst teacher ever. No ifs, ands, or buts. Not only is she useless at explaining anything, she also gives extremely tough and mostly irrelevant exams. To top it off, she's an absolute witch!! Under no circumstances should you take a course with her.

Follows text closely. This is hard material to understand, but he will clarify if you have questions. Need to read and practice on your own though, otherwise the best teacher will not help you in this course.

Excellent professor, highly recommended if you want to understand the subject. He cares for his students. My background is in economics and he helped me understand the subject. He encouraged me and offered 4 extra sessions before the final where he reviewed the material. A very intelligent professor.  Ich bin Ihnen sehr dankbar Dr.Vielen Dank

This class is hard and has a lot of content. You cover 10 chapters in 3 months and there is A LOT to remember. This course is based on proving mathematical statements, and unfortunately Pyke doesn't teach proof theory very much. His proofs are very confusing and he expects your proofs to be ridiculously rigorous for an intro course. Very hard exams
lecture is fine, but sometime its boring....
I love JASON!!
Excellent prof. He has a passion for Math that makes a course that could be as boring and arduous as 242 deeply interesting. I hope to have him in the future

Incredibly great prof!  This could have been the worst math course ever, but instead he made it one of the best.  Midterms were pretty easy, but the final was quite a bit more difficult.  Take courses with him if you want to really know what you're doing.

Jungic is an awesome guy and an awesome professor. He's always willing to take the time to help you after class. He's even held "mini-lectures" in his office when a group of us don't understand a concept. The course was very hard. The exam was e
No Comments
He reviews midterms and finals beforehand so make sure to attend those. He is a nice guy with clear expectations and is always willing to help struggling students.
Good prof for this proof-heavy course. Redo examples and practice theorems - his review sessions provide helpful guidance. Also found Unstuckstudy useful for exam prep alongside the textbook.

Good prof. Midterms & Final were fair. HW can be tricky but doable. A lot to remember as course goes on. Keep track of definitions & theorems. Before exams he does a review, stay faithful to it, hints to what theorems u should know proof for. Redo ex's covered in class and HW questions. TA's don't have a marking scheme, pick TA that marks easiest.

He's a great prof. The course is proof based so you need to practice a lot. I liked that he communicated everything clearly and that there were no surprises during the semester. I also appreciated that he gave a clear guide of what to study/expect for the final exam.

This is a tough course. But I don't see how any prof can make this course easier and still serve its purpose. Overall, I think he is clear and the exams are fair. Assignments take time but will really help your exams if you understand the assignments questions and the lecture notes. A lot of memorization needed for this course.
easiest math prof EVER! clear notes + very helpful
